ol.li: In a large skillet, over medium heat, melt the butter.
Sprinkle thyme, salt & pepper evenly over the chicken.
Add the chicken to pan and brown on both sides, approx. 4 minutes per side.
Remove the chicken to a plate. (Chicken does not need to be cooked through).
Add the onions, carrot and bacon to the pan and sauté until the bacon fat has rendered.
Add the garlic and mushrooms, sauté another 3 minutes.
Add the chicken back to the pan, pour in the wine and allow everything to come to a boil.
Turn the heat down to simmer and cover, leaving a little room for steam to escape.
Simmer 10 minutes, thoroughly cooking chicken, until internal temp reaches 165 degrees.
Add chicken stock and cream, turn up heat to medium and cook another 10 minutes, uncovered, allowing the sauce to thicken.
Stir in fresh thyme, sprinkle the chopped parsley, add salt and pepper to taste.
Serve alone, over rice or noodles.
Combine the ground beef, all but 3 tablespoons of the parsley, green onion, salt, and pepper. Shape mixture into 4 oval patties.
Place 2 tablespoons of flour into a dish and dredge each patty through the flour.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the patties and sauté until browned on each side.
Remove patties from the pan to a plate.
Add onions to the pan and sauté 5 minutes.
Stir in the garlic and tomato paste, sauté until paste begins to brown, about 1 min.
Sprinkle the remaining flour over the paste. Cook 1 minute. Stir in broth, wine, and thyme.
Return patties to the pan and bring sauce to a boil.
Reduce heat to medium-low. Cover pan and simmer for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, add bread to a baking sheet. Butter each piece and lightly sprinkle with garlic powder, a pinch of paprika and half the parmesan cheese. Bake until bread is crisp.
To serve, place the toast on a plate, the patty onto the toast, ladle the onion sauce over the top. Finish with the rest of the parmesan cheese and remaining parsley.
Heat 2-tablespoon oil in large saucepan.
Sauté the mushrooms, onions and garlic over low heat for 3 minutes, or until soft.
In large bowl, add mushroom mixture, oats, parmesan, breadcrumbs, egg, parsley, oregano, salt and pepper, mix well.
Shape mixture into patties.
Heat 2 oil in large skillet over medium heat.
Sauté patties, cooking about 4 minutes on each side – or until golden brown.
In a medium bowl, combine peppers, panko, breadcrumbs, garlic and salmon.
In a small bowl, combine egg, soy sauce, lemon zest, parsley, salt & pepper.
Add to pepper mixture tossing gently to combine.
Form mixture into 8 patties.
Lightly coat a grill or skillet with cooking spray.
Using medium-high heat, add the patties and cook approximately 5 minutes per side.
Pre-heat over to 350 degrees.
Using a small knife, cut a slit lengthwise down one side of each poblano pepper.
Make a small crosswise slit along the top to create a T-shape, try not to cut off the top.
Scoop out the seeds, core and ribs using your thumb or a small spoon.

Using tongs, roast each poblano pepper over an open flame, such as a grill or gas stovetop. (Pepper’s can also be tossed through a tablespoon of oil, place onto a baking sheet, cut side down and roasted in the oven at 450 degrees until blackened.)
Roast until the skin is completely blistered and blackened. Transfer to a glass bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Let steam for 10-15 min.
Meanwhile, using a food processor, add the jalapeño, tomatoes, onion, garlic, cumin, paprika, salt & pepper, along with 1/4 cup of water. Bend until smooth.
In a large nonstick skillet, over medium heat, add the canola oil.
Add the tomato mixture to the skillet and simmer, until slightly thick.
Pour the tomato mixture into the bottom of a 9x13-baking dish.
Return skillet back over the heat and follow the directions for the filling below.
Add another tablespoon of oil to the skillet; add the onion, garlic and cilantro, sauté 1 minute.
Add the chicken, beans, broth, cumin, garlic powder, coriander, salt & pepper.
Use a table knife, scrape off the charred skins of the poblano peppers.
Carefully stuff each pepper with the filling.
Place each pepper in the casserole dish and top with the shredded cheese.
Cover with foil and bake for 20-30 minutes.
Garnish with cilantro.
To cook the squash, Pre-heat oven to 450 degrees.
Using a vegetable peeler, peel the skin off the squash.
Cut top and bottom off and discard.
Cut squash in half and place face down on a baking sheet that has been sprayed with cooking spray or oil.
Cover with foil and bake 35-45 min. or until squash is tender.
Remove to cool.
Leave oven pre-heated to 450 degrees.
Heat a small saucepan over medium heat, add garlic and shallot, sauté for 2 minutes.
In a large bowl, combine squash, garlic and shallot mixture, nutmeg, sage and the egg white of one egg.
Add a little salt and pepper, mix well and set aside.
In another medium bowl, combine 1-cup mozzarella, ricotta, milk and remaining egg.
Spray a 9x13 baking dish with cooking spray.
Spread a ⅓ cup of cheese mixture in the bottom of the dish.
Arrange 3 noodles over cheese mixture.
Top with half of squash mixture.
Top with 1½ cups of spinach.
Spread another ⅓ cup of cheese mixture over the spinach.
Cover with 3 noodles again, then the remaining squash mixture.
Spinach again, ending with the cheese mixture on top.
Sprinkle remaining Mozzarella cheese on top.
Cover with foil and bake for 20 minutes.
Remove foil and bake another 10 minutes.
Let stand for 5 minutes to cut perfect squares.
Pre-heat oven to 450 degrees.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Place the flour, sugar, and salt into the bowl of a food processor, fitted with a steel blade.
Pulse a few times to combine.
Add the butter and pulse 12-15 times, or until the butter is the size of peas.
Add the ice water all at once. Keep pulsing to combine, about another 12 times.
Turn the dough out onto a well-floured board, roll it into a ball, and cut in half forming into 2 disks.
Roll each pastry into an 11-inch circle on a lightly floured surface and transfer to the baking sheet.
In a large skillet, over medium heat, add the butter and apples. Sauté 5 minutes.
Sprinkle the brown sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg and salt over the apples. Stir in vanilla.
Mix well and sauté until the apples have cooked down (about 7 minutes).
Pour mixture into the middle of the pastry crusts, dividing evenly.
Gently fold a 2” border of the pastry, inward, over the fruit.
Pleat the folds to make a seal.
Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool for 5 minutes.
Using 2 large spatulas, transfer to a cutting board.
Using a pizza roller, cut into triangles.
Serve warm or at room temperature.
In a large stock pot, over medium heat, add the canola oil, carrots, and onion.
Sauté 3 minutes, add the leek, thyme, fennel, salt, & pepper, sauté another 5 minutes to bring out the sweetness in the vegetables.
Add asparagus to cook 2 minutes.
Add the garlic, cook 1 min.
Add broth and bring to a boil.
Stir in spinach, reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Garnish with fresh chives or parsley before serving.
In a large pot, over medium heat, add the canola oil and bacon, cook until crisp.
Using a slotted spoon, transfer bacon to paper towel and set aside. Leave bacon drippings.
Add corn kernels, red pepper, onion, jalapeño, red pepper flakes, thyme, thyme, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Sauté vegetables together until soft and golden brown.
Add creamed corn and broth, bring to a boil.
Stir in half and half, the shredded chicken and bacon.
Cook another 10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper; add the copped chives and serve!
Add sausage to the blended vegetables, along with kale.
Using an immersion blender, lower into stock pot and pulse 10 times, blending all the ingredients. The soup can also be added to a blender and blended well.
Cook to brown the sausage, stir in red pepper flakes. Set aside.
Meanwhile, in medium skillet, over medium heat, add the sausage.
Increase the heat to high. Simmer 15 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Stir in the garlic, cook for 1 minute.
Add the onion, carrot, and celery to the pot. Saute another 5-8 minutes.
Once the oil is hot, fennel, and red pepper, season with salt and pepper. Saute 5 minutes, allowing the fennel to brown.
In a large stock pot, over medium high heat, add the oil.
Add the chicken stock, oregano, basil, and thyme,
*As a second meal, pour over a bed of boiled penne pasta and add fresh Parmesan cheese.
